content: the huggable tote crochet pattern by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful https //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy @prettypeacefulcrochet pretty peaceful on facebook pretty peaceful youtube video tutorials tutorial video for the huggable tote on youtube https //youtu be/znkf76v555o finished size 18 wide 11 tall 2 deep 46 x 28 x 5 cm gauge 11 5 sts and 10 row = 4 10 cm in single_crochet yarn super bulky bernat blanket perfect phasing 1 cake in the fuschia colorway 100% polyester 220 yards 201 meters /300 grams hook 6 mm us size j notions removable stitch marker tapestry needle 59 inches of ¾ wide 150 cm long and 2 cm wide faux leather strap or additional yarn to crochet the straps pattern note the body of the tote is worked in a continuous spiral from an oval base do not slip stitch to join rounds terms us chain chain yarn over and pull through loop on hook st stitch single_crochet single_crochet insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch yarn over and pull through both loops on hook chain 40 round 1 3 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook skipped chain does not count as st single_crochet in next 37 chain 3 single_crochet in last chain single_crochet in next 37 chain working along the other side of the starting chain 80 sts round 2 2 single_crochet in next st 3 times single_crochet in next 37 sts 2 single_crochet in next st 3 times single_crochet in next 37 sts 86 sts round 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 3 times single_crochet in next 37 sts 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 3 times single_crochet in next 37 sts 92 sts round 4 single_crochet in next 3 sts 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 3 times single_crochet in next 40 sts 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 3 times single_crochet in next 37 sts 98 sts rounds 5-26 single_crochet in each st 98 sts fasten_off and weave in ends after round 4 attach the straps cut two 29 5 lengths 75 cm of faux leather poke two holes close to the end of the strap about ½ apart 1 3 cm apart and centered on the strap then poke two more holes about 1 5 3 8 cm further up the strap using a hole punch sharp tool or hammer and nail with a yarn needle and the same yarn used for the bag sew the strap to the bag through the holes sew through each hole twice as shown at the 24-minute mark of the tutorial video https //youtu be/znkf76v555o knot the ends and weave the ends into the bag share your tote with #huggabletote on instagram tag me @prettypeacefulcrochet because i love to see your
